title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:05 <polx> has quit  
00:20 <vmassol> has quit  
01:11 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
01:13 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:21 <jvdrean1> has quit  
03:21 <Denis> has quit  
03:52 <tekzilla> has quit  
03:54 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
03:54 <ries\_> has quit  
04:39 <ries> has joined #xwiki  
07:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:16 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <tmortagne> has quit  
07:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <+mflorea> vmassol: good morning  
07:59 <vmassol> good morning mflorea  
08:01 <+mflorea> I need to skip the distribution wizard in lots of places and I'm looking for a way to avoid duplicating code. I can think of: creating an AbstracAllTests, creating a Suite extending PageObjectSuite, modifying PageObjectSuite. What's the best solution?  
08:03 <vmassol> where do we need to skip it?  
08:04 <vmassol> in platform's functional tests only right?  
08:04 <vmassol> actually not even there  
08:04 <+mflorea> no, in enterprise tests too  
08:04 <vmassol> since they don't start with an empty wiki  
08:04 <+mflorea> it doesn't matter  
08:04 <+mflorea> the wizard appears even if the wiki is not empty, if there is not previous state of the distribution  
08:05 <vmassol> hmmm maybe that's the problem  
08:05 <vmassol> why would we want this?  
08:05 <vmassol> IMO it's bad  
08:05 <+mflorea> because we don't know what is installed  
08:05 <vmassol> and?  
08:06 <vmassol> why do we need to knoww hat's installed if the user doesn't want an upgrade  
08:06 <vmassol> ?  
08:06 <+mflorea> how do you know the user wants an upgrade?  
08:07 <vmassol> when he goes to the admin to import or to the EM maybe  
08:07 <+mflorea> since there is no previous state of the distribution you don't know if it's an upgrade or not  
08:07 <vmassol> ah ok I understand  
08:07 <vmassol> his wiki may not work if the war has been changed  
08:07 <vmassol> so it needs to be the first thing that happens  
08:07 <vmassol> right?  
08:08 <+mflorea> yes  
08:08 <vmassol> so the solution for us  
08:08 <vmassol> is to have the xar version and the war version in sync for the functional tests  
08:08 <vmassol> no?  
08:08 <vmassol> either that or set that config flag  
08:10 <+mflorea> I'm not sure the sync will help  
08:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <+mflorea> tmortagne: vmassol is asking if it's normal to get the distribution wizard on a new instance of XE  
08:11 <+tmortagne> you mean a new instance of hsqldb/jetty distribution ?  
08:11 <+mflorea> and if there are ways to void this instead of using the configuration flag  
08:11 <+mflorea> yes  
08:12 <+tmortagne> right now it's normal yes simply because the distribution module think you did not installed the UI since it does not find it  
08:13 <+mflorea> marking the imported xar as installed is not done yet right?  
08:13 <vmassol> bbiab  
08:15 <+mflorea> I mean, we won't need the configuration flag anymore when the imported xar will be marked as installed.  
08:16 <tmortagne> has quit  
08:17 <+mflorea> hmm, but the problem is that we import enterprise-ui-all not enterprise-ui with its deps..  
08:22 <mflorea> has quit  
08:22 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <+tmortagne> back, my connection is almost unusable this morning (just moved on my phone)  
08:26 <+tmortagne> re jetty/hsqldb: the main issue is that between the project actually building the database and the one creating the distribution the information about installed extensions is lost  
08:28 <+tmortagne> guys: slf4j 1.7.0 released with "This version adds varargs support in Logger methods." that will be nice ;)  
08:52 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5f82928 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5f82928607dd7872259265feb917136009e7c34e / (5 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/AUeZSg  
09:02 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r6b37662 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/6b37662f3ec8ac4665a49ad04a13d97264708cb3 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/tnblTg  
09:02 <polx> has quit  
09:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r6a06028 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/6a06028e506e8fa8f950a983c76963db6f0cf5c9 / xwiki-enterprise-distribution/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/pom.xml : Add missing virtual extensions - http://git.io/sd34ZA  
09:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <+mflorea> looks like commits don't trigger CI builds anymore..  
09:52 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
10:00 <CIA-121> Denis Gervalle stable-4.1.x \* rf58d3de https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f58d3de9a468d770b5695a8fd551c2a08e7edf13 / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : Clean up CLIRR exclusions after 4.1.4 release - http://git.io/eybl5Q  
10:04 <vmassol> well done Denis for your second release! :)  
10:06 <+sburjan> are we going to put 4.1.4 on myxwiki before we can say it's recommended ?  
10:06 <+sburjan> so users can test it  
10:08 <vmassol> no  
10:08 <vmassol> myxwiki.org is for new stuf  
10:08 <vmassol> stuff  
10:08 <vmassol> it should have 4.2M3  
10:09 <vmassol> (right now it should be in 4.2M2)  
10:09 <vmassol> but xwiki.org could be in 4.1.4 (I was waiting for it actually)  
10:10 <+sburjan> ok  
10:12 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r0d14b23 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0d14b23d70fe9f8c5efd76325925d6329980208e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/extension.vm : Add escaping. - http://git.io/exZdAA  
10:22 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r1cc5e01 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/1cc5e01d8ad48a3f885f2a3191839e70a940d363 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Fix escaping tests. - http://git.io/gJwaNg  
10:23 <+mflorea> does anyone have any idea why CI builds are not triggered anymore by git commits?  
10:24 <+evalica> no - but Eduard triggered yesterday a manual build and it the build worked  
10:25 <+tmortagne> mflorea: I thin kthere has been some change on github recently maybe the event its supposed to sent to jenkins has been removed for some reason  
10:25 <+tmortagne> checking  
10:26 <+tmortagne> yep seems to be the issue  
10:26 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/admin/hooks  
10:26 <+tmortagne> jenkins is not enabled  
10:26 <+mflorea> I get 404  
10:26 <+tmortagne> look like there is two different github plugin for jenkins  
10:27 <+mflorea> probably because I'm not an admin  
10:28 <+tmortagne> we need to make sure which one we have or if we need to change our maybe deprecated one for a new one  
10:28 <+mflorea> I see we have both http://ci.xwiki.org/pluginManager/  
10:29 <vmassol> tma  
10:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: we were not using Jenkins hook  
10:29 <vmassol> but the web hook  
10:29 <vmassol> which is there  
10:30 <vmassol> the jenkins hook is new (never seen it before)  
10:30 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok I knew we were using github but I tough is what a specialized hook  
10:30 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/github-webhook/  
10:30 <+tmortagne> s/is what/it was/  
10:30 <vmassol> not sure why we have 2 bitbucket hooks  
10:30 <vmassol> we should need only one but not sure which one  
10:30 <vmassol> ;)  
10:30 <vmassol> I think it's for jira  
10:31 <vmassol> (well I'm sure it's for jira)  
10:31 <+mflorea> http://ci.xwiki.org/github-webhook/ throws 500  
10:31 <vmassol> yes that's normal mflorea  
10:31 <+tmortagne> so indeed the web hook is still enabled  
10:31 <vmassol> you cannot it in a GET in a browser  
10:31 <vmassol> s/cannot/cannot call/  
10:31 <vmassol> I even raised a jira issue for jenkins about this  
10:31 <vmassol> ;)  
10:32 <+mflorea> sure, but the exception doesn't look nice, anyway  
10:32 <vmassol> but it shouldn't be a problem  
10:32 <vmassol> sure sure  
10:32 <vmassol> but that doesn't mean it's not working  
10:32 <vmassol> it has always done that  
10:32 <+mflorea> ok  
10:33 <+mflorea> I see there is a test button on github for webhooks  
10:34 <vmassol> we might want to stop using a webhook and try the jenkins hook now that it's there  
10:34 <vmassol> seems more appropriate  
10:35 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:37 <+mflorea> there are two jenkins hooks, should we use the one based on Github plugin?  
10:38 <vmassol> no idea  
10:38 <+mflorea> the one based on Git plugin needs version 1.1.18 and we have 1.1.16. We can upgrade though  
10:38 <vmassol> yep been a long time we haven't upgaded  
10:53 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:08 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm thinking to set skipWizard=true in PersistentTestContext  
11:10 <vmassol> doesn't look good to me  
11:10 <vmassol> looks very hackish  
11:10 <vmassol> we don't do this kind of things there  
11:10 <vmassol> would be better in the executor  
11:10 <+mflorea> yes, but I don't see another common point between tests  
11:10 <vmassol> IMO  
11:11 <vmassol> since this is where we define the configuration  
11:11 <+tmortagne> there is a place where we disable repositories, you might want to put your properties there  
11:12 <+tmortagne> I think it's in the executor  
11:12 <vmassol> you can already pass a xwiki properties file  
11:12 <vmassol> saveXWikiCfg and saveXWikiProperties  
11:13 <+mflorea> tmortagne: XWikiExecutor doesn't disable repos  
11:14 <+mflorea> repos are disabled in AllTests, using a method annotated with XWikiExecutorSuite.PreStart  
11:14 <vmassol> mflorea: what about setting some pom config which is saved by the executor  
11:14 <vmassol> (using saveXWikiProperties)  
11:15 <vmassol> ie externalize this to the module  
11:15 <vmassol> note: I hav"n't thought long and hard about the topic though but I'm pretty sure PersistentTestContext is not the right place  
11:16 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:16 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* r42b3e94 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/42b3e94452a2ded14f229b41e205b4b2ae365cf0 / (11 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-8183: Provide a more readable toString implementation for Entity and Document References - http://git.io/ZEgZPQ  
11:17 <+mflorea> even if I move it in the pom I still need to avoid duplication, and put them in a root pom so be available for all tests  
11:21 <vmassol> I wouldn't put that in the root pom  
11:21 <vmassol> especialyl since not all tests want it  
11:22 <vmassol> so you need to find a way to provide different configurations for different categories of tests  
11:23 <vmassol> I'd like to finish something first but I can help you later on (after lunch) if you need  
11:23 <vmassol> (unless someone else helps before ofc :)  
11:24 <+mflorea> ok, I'll work on something else in the mean time  
11:24 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:32 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:37 <mflorea> has quit  
11:41 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* rc40b9e6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c40b9e6a8327b077bbb4620b8d02229efeddde8d / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/rights/internal/XWikiAnnotationRightService.java : [Misc] Use proper SLF4J way of logging - http://git.io/og3RPQ  
11:41 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* rb997a49 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b997a499e2b9fde7d4404d3b413bb361e6016d38 / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-8183: Provide a more readable toString implementation for Entity and Document References - http://git.io/HGcC8w  
11:41 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* r988718b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/988718bc033f8afc0e1443dea07962ebf35eaf6d / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-model/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/internal/reference/LocalizedStringEntityReferenceSerializer.java : XWIKI-8183: Provide a more readable toString implementation for Entity and Document References - http://git.io/dFdCyA  
11:42 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r985338c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/985338c951e5158aa0a6804813075272cbf31d2a / (5 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7927 : Create an entry point for all available applications inside the wiki - http://git.io/BZIYXQ  
11:56 <+jvdrean> I promise that's the last commit I slip into 4.2M3  
11:57 <vmassol> a big one :)  
11:58 <vmassol> so what's our status for M3 release?  
11:58 <vmassol> build still fail?  
11:58 <vmassol> seems so  
11:58 <vmassol> quite a lot of red  
11:59 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:59 <vmassol> hmm seems thre are some display issues:  
11:59 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-index-test-tests/2510/testReport/junit/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_index\_test\_ui\_AllTests/  
11:59 <vmassol> mf   
11:59 <vmassol> oops he's not here  
12:03 <ries> has quit  
12:04 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r87f3de1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/87f3de1a4c240fca52bc6e2c45660509a0bab28e / xwiki-enterprise-ui/pom.xml : XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/bVF\_RA  
12:06 <vmassol> haha broken promise!  
12:06 <vmassol> :)  
12:06 <vmassol> you look like Jack Bauer now!  
12:06 <vmassol> (he keeps saying "I promise" all the time in his movies ;))  
12:07 <vmassol> you won't get hurt, I promise....  
12:10 <+jvdrean> exactly, this last one was a harmless commit ;)  
12:12 <vmassol> :)  
12:12 <+jvdrean> talking about Jack Bauer, did you see the add he appears in for Acer ? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5zemXwxg8Og  
12:13 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <vmassol> yep I've seen it  
12:37 <CIA-121> tmortagne feature-xarpluginextensions \* r9105d76 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9105d7690b16c1cfba582fdad83f7b9b3c764fab / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-script/src/test/java/org/xwiki/extension/script/internal/ExtensionManagerScriptServiceTest.java : [cleanup] Apply codestyle - http://git.io/7RmNzA  
12:37 <CIA-121> tmortagne feature-xarpluginextensions \* r6a20dc9 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6a20dc9026b0536f90e10030fa8bc055a8172ca2 / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8184: Make importer mojo of packager plugin support generating extensions index - http://git.io/Ifr5dg  
12:42 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:04 <vmassol> jvdrean: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2512/#showFailuresLink  
13:06 <+jvdrean> vmassol: thanks, fixing  
13:07 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r478fdf1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/478fdf12672465d3128bcdc6aa424a05fcf315a7 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes-ui/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/ApplicationsPanelEntry.xml : XWIKI-8181 : Allow AppWithinMinutes applications to provide entries in the Applications panel - http://git.io/UDhFkw  
13:07 <vmassol> there are test failures too  
13:14 <+jvdrean> I'm looking at them, I'm not able to reproduce locally yet (I'm trying with -U right now)  
13:19 <+sburjan> Hello. I am creating a class, and I want to have a property which stores only one user. I am looking, and I see only "List of Users". Which is the best practice to achieve my goal ?  
13:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <+Enygma`> sburjan: AFAIK, List of Users stores just one user. If you want to make it store more than one user, tick the "Multiple Select" checkbox in the class editor.  
13:39 <+sburjan> thanks Enygma`  
13:41 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* r115110b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/115110babc43c1fd889dd9ec5173fb84e7ac6634 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-uiextension/xwiki-platform-uiextension-api/src/test/java/org/xwiki/uiextension/WikiUIExtensionTest.java : [Misc] Added missing javadoc - http://git.io/uazndg  
14:22 <evalica> has left #xwiki  
14:23 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r2052b10 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/2052b10eb46db1631accf812bd6b2305fb81f924 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/pom.xml : XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/z7l5mw  
14:23 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r23a34f2 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/23a34f20fc752e3dd4bbe810b58e64b4aef4ba40 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/AllTests.java : XWIKI-7896: Display a global install/upgrade wizard when starting an new version of an XWiki instance - http://git.io/CDbZ5w  
14:37 <vmassol> Enygma`: can you please ensure that you push everyone to release M3 ASAP, that means analysing what's blocking and acting as a facilitator :)  
14:38 <+Enygma`> vmassol: yep. Right now I`m going trough what is currently missing  
14:38 <vmassol> great  
14:41 <+Enygma`> vmassol: I think I would also need Jira admin rights for some parts of the release process  
14:41 <vmassol> sure  
14:41 <vmassol> I'm adding you  
14:43 <vmassol> done  
14:43 <+Enygma`> thanks  
14:46 <CIA-121> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r37f84af https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/37f84affcdd93fa88e49eaf8d810bf1a5ff190b2 / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-649 : Mechanism for inserting custom content in pre-existing code - http://git.io/U3hSLA  
15:02 <Denis> has quit  
15:11 <vmassol> jvdrean: testin your latest app panel now (just finishing the rebuild)  
15:16 <vmassol> mflorea: just want to check that you're working on making the jetty distribution recognized as an up to date distribution before the end of 4.2  
15:16 <vmassol> (right now I get this when I start XE that I've just built: http://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/a6272143-2157-4598-82a7-3e3605e84d28/72c4093b525a641319e61c926a5f4991 )  
15:16 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm not working on that  
15:17 <vmassol> great  
15:17 <vmassol> the dialog box is nice  
15:17 <vmassol> I think it's missing some context infirmation  
15:17 <vmassol> so that the users understands what's goingon  
15:17 <+mflorea> I said "I'm \_not\_" :)  
15:17 <vmassol> ah bad  
15:17 <vmassol> is thomas working on it?  
15:17 <vmassol> we need that  
15:17 <vmassol> this is our distribution for newcomers and people trying out xwiki  
15:18 <+mflorea> I think so, but you need to ask him  
15:18 <vmassol> so it must absolutely be working OOB very well  
15:18 <vmassol> ok  
15:18 <vmassol> he's offline now  
15:18 <vmassol> hmm  
15:18 <vmassol> if I click skip  
15:18 <vmassol> I get a second box saying that all extensions are up to date  
15:18 <+mflorea> I'm going to work on displaying the install plan live  
15:18 <vmassol> that's weird  
15:19 <+mflorea> yes, that's the second step on the wizard  
15:19 <vmassol> I didn't ask it to install anything  
15:19 <vmassol> and before it was saying I was not up to date  
15:19 <vmassol> so as a user I have a WTF moment  
15:19 <+mflorea> where did you see "not up to date"?  
15:19 <vmassol> with a "reload" button I don't understand either  
15:19 <vmassol> It asked me to install some version it couldn't find  
15:19 <+mflorea> there is no "no up to date" message  
15:20 <vmassol> so it means I wasn't up to date  
15:20 <+mflorea> it did not ask you to install  
15:20 <+mflorea> it only said that is the recomended version  
15:20 <+mflorea> and it couldn't get more info about it  
15:21 <+mflorea> but anyway, I agree it need more context messages  
15:22 <vmassol> jvdrean: it's very nice :)  
15:23 <vmassol> it improves the navigation a lot  
15:25 <vmassol> I feel this is a huge improvement for our users  
15:25 <vmassol> now we need to update all our apps on e.x.o :)  
15:26 <+jvdrean> vmassol: I like it too, it feels "natural"  
15:26 <vmassol> yep  
15:26 <+jvdrean> about that, could you make me an admin on xwiki-contrib ?  
15:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <+jvdrean> vmassol: did you create an app with AWM ?
